iti90:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti90:2.1: “Mendicants, these three kinds of confidence are the best.
iti90:2.3: Mendicants, the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, is said to be the best of all sentient beings—be they footless, with two feet, four feet, or many feet; with form or formless; with perception or without perception or with neither perception nor non-perception.
iti90:2.4: Those who have confidence in the Buddha have confidence in the best.
iti90:2.5: Having confidence in the best, the result is the best.
iti90:3.1: Fading away is said to be the best of all things whether conditioned or unconditioned. That is, the quelling of vanity, the removing of thirst, the abolishing of clinging, the breaking of the round, the ending of craving, fading away, cessation, extinguishment.
iti90:3.2: Those who have confidence in the teaching of fading away have confidence in the best.
iti90:3.3: Having confidence in the best, the result is the best.
iti90:4.1: The Saṅgha of the Realized One’s disciples is said to be the best of all communities and groups. It consists of the four pairs, the eight individuals. This is the Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples that is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.
iti90:4.2: Those who have confidence in the Saṅgha have confidence in the best.
iti90:4.3: Having confidence in the best, the result is the best.
iti90:4.4: These are the three best kinds of confidence.”
iti90:4.5: That is what the Buddha said.
iti90:5.1: “For those who, knowing the best teaching,
iti90:5.2: base their confidence on the best—
iti90:5.3: confident in the best Awakened One,
iti90:5.4: supremely worthy of a religious donation;
iti90:6.2: the bliss of fading and stilling;
iti90:8.1: An intelligent person gives to the best,
iti90:8.3: When they become a god or human,
iti90:8.4: they rejoice at reaching the best.”
iti90:9.1: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
